thread.title: Is Pan the biggest flop of all time?
thread.title_full: Is Pan the biggest flop of all time?

title: Is Pan the biggest flop of all time?
text:
Pan could join list of biggest flops of all time Corey Sinclair News Corp Australia Network Pan could join list of biggest flops of all time Corey Sinclair News Corp Australia Network Hugh Jackman And Rooney Mara At New York Pan Premiere 0:54 
Hugh Jackman was looking fresh faced at the premiere of 'Pan' in New York. Hugh tackles the role of Pirate Black Beard but went for a clean cut look on the red carpet. He opted for a dark suit and blue shirt that he wore with the collar open. Hugh was joined by the young star of the film Levi Miller who plays Pan. The 12-year-old was full of smiles and worked a smart casual look of a blazer and some chinos. Rooney Mara was elegant in a lace ensemble. Her high neck dress featured a black peplum skirt and some floral details. She wore her hair straight and sleek and kept her make up neutral. October 6th 2015 8 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ 
IT was meant to be the start of a new successful family-friendly franchise for Warner Brothers, but the latest big-budget adaptation of the Peter Pan origin story has failed to capture the imagination of cinemagoers. 
The film, Pan , is now expected to see losses between $130 million to $150 million after it recorded less than stellar openings in North America and internationally, according to the Hollywood Reporter . 
So far the film, directed by Joe Wright, has managed to take $15.3 million in North America and $25.2 million internationally, which are a far cry from the $275 million price tag expert analysts have attached to the film’s production and marketing. Flop ... Antonio Banderas starred in The 13th Warrior Walk through fire ... Keanu Reeve’s turn in 47 Ronin was highly criticised Cutthroat industry ... Matthew Modine and Geena Davis starred in the flop Cutthroat Island Lesson learnt ... Disney stopped putting ‘mars’ in the titles of films after the box office failure that was Mars Needs Moms Comedy legend ... even Eddie Murphy’s comedic chops couldn’t save The Adventures of Pluto Nash 1 of n 
Many are apprehensive to label the film a flop just yet, instead choosing to wait and see how the film performs in the world’s second-largest film market, China, later this month. 
But if the film does record the forecast losses, it will go down as one of the biggest flops in Hollywood history. 
The film was green-lit in 2013 as part of a plan formulated by the incoming Warner Bros. Entertainment CEO Kevin Tsujihara and his team to fill the family-friendly franchise void left by their successful Harry Potter series. Other Stories
